adjectives.description: theomorphic (comparative more theomorphic, superlative most theomorphic)

entries.meaning: Having the form of God or a god.
examples: Man is a theomorphic being; endowed with the intelligence (al-'aql) which can lead him to the truth, to knowledge of Allah and to unity (tawhid).

entries.meaning: Of, pertaining to or involving the conception of man as having the form of God or a god.
examples: It seems that the more remote from scientific realization is the idea that the philosopher is searching to grasp, the more theomorphic the explanation will tend to be.
